sections.title: First section
sections.introductory_text: This is the introductory text to the first section of this template.
sections.comment: This is the comment to the first section of this template.

sections.title: Empty section
sections.introductory_text: This is a section without any questions.
sections.comment: Since there aren't any questions, nothing to do here.

sections.label: A label!
sections.title: Second empty section
sections.introductory_text: Yet another empty section, to test that moving over several empty sections work.

sections.title: Last section
sections.introductory_text: This is the introductory text to the last section
sections.comment: This section also has a comment.

questions.question: Why did the chicken cross the road?
questions.help_text: Yes, this is a joke. It also shows off a "choice" question. Just pick one. Feel free to discuss this class of joke in the "Notes"-field.
questions.comment: This is a comment. It is in addition to the help text. Each choice in the form have their own help texts for this question, check the html code, the div with class "answers".

questions.question: Pick two dates, the first earlier than the last.
questions.help_text: This shows off the date range type.
questions.framing_text: The dates chosen are between {start} and {end}.

questions.question: What is the main weapon of The Spanish Inquisition?
questions.framing_text: The main weapon of the Spanish Inquisition is {}.

questions.question: Is this the final question of the first section?
questions.help_text: Another joke, and showing off the "bool" question.

questions.question: Think of an url. Any url.
questions.help_text: This is the "namedurl" question. The url is obligatory, the name is not.

questions.question: (H2020) Per data type, why are they restricted?
questions.help_text: This is an example of a "multidmptypedreasononetext" question. This is a question very specialized for H2020. You need to explain why specific data types cannot be fully publicly accessible.

questions.question: If a tree falls in a forest and no one is around to hear it, does it make a sound?
questions.help_text: A new joke for a new section.

questions.question: But really, why did the chicken cross the road?
questions.help_text: This is a "reason" question. Please explain.

questions.question: How many trees would a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck trees?
questions.help_text: This is a "positiveinteger" question. 0 is okay, really.

questions.question: What's your favorite file format?
questions.help_text: This is an "externalchoice" question. The choices are fetched via API and cached before they are rendered here.

questions.question: Pick a license
questions.help_text: If the license you would prefer is not in the list, choose "Not listed".

questions.question: Select one or more in the list below:
questions.help_text: This is an "externalmultichoiceonetext" question. You have to choose at least one. The choices are fetched from an API and cached before being rendered here.

questions.question: Pick one or more, optionally checking off "Not Listed":
questions.help_text: This is an "extmultichoicenotlistedonetext" question. The choices are fetched by API and cached before rendering. You do not need to choose anything, but in that case, tick off "not listed". If you can't find what you're looking for you can also tick off "not listed".

canned_answers.canned_text: The chicken crossed the road due to inflation.
canned_answers.comment: This is a comment to the canned answer "Because of inflation". This was added because for the 2016 dmp tool, the cannned text looked like "Canned text COMMENT comment" and some javascript picked out the text after "COMMENT" and displayed it in a popup when hovering above the choice.

canned_answers.choice: To get to the other side
canned_answers.canned_text: The chicken crossed the road in order to get to the other side.
canned_answers.comment: This is a comment to the canned answer "To get to the other side".  This was added because for the 2016 dmp tool, the cannned text looked like "Canned text COMMENT comment" and some javascript picked out the text after "COMMENT" and displayed it in a popup when hovering above the choice.

This is a comment to the answer "What chicken?!". This was added because for the 2016 dmp tool, the cannned text looked like "Canned text COMMENT comment" and some javascript picked out the text after "COMMENT" and displayed it in a popup when hovering above the choice. This answer lacks a canned text, and falls back to just showing "What chicken?!" in the generated HTML.

canned_answers.choice: an almost fanatical devotion to the Pope

canned_answers.canned_text: This was the final question of the section.
This was not the final question of the section.
